lines.text: Find yourself a table, doll.
I can never understand it.
You ought to by now.

Yeah, maybe. I still don't get the percentage. Somebody wants to get real loaded, that I can understand. It's normal, if you know what I mean. But, this, I don't get? You never figure how guys can get themselves hooked like this. Still, if it makes you happy, it makes me happy. It's all money.

[singing]
I'm just a livin', lovin' soul who simply wants to rock-n-roll...
Well, where have you been?
Crawled around the wet belly in the gutter, lookin' for dope peddlers, needle pushers, saying filthy things, day in and day out.

I'd like to get ahold of a couple a million dollars from one of these foundations and hire a few doctors and find out why people keep sticking needles in themselves. I'd like to do that a lot. But, I'm too busy here trying to find out how the junk gets into the country.

Every now and again we get some little junkie in here who's so far down the line he's makin' half a buck profit on a twenty dollar shot. He doesn't even know what year it is - never mind who's hiring him. It doesn't seem to add up, does it?
Look, I don't want to get in no kind of trouble.
Cashling, you're in so much trouble, now, it's gonna make your ears wiggle.
Will you stop tryin' to fight a one man war!

he's had a go of a bit of everything, including white slavery. But, he's been quite discreet lately. Changed everything about himself. His methods. His habits. His name. Even his face. Taken himself a part, you might say. But, we've put him back together again - like Humpty Dumpty.
Well, look who's here.
Frank, please get rid of them.
I can't spoil the party, darling. It only started yesterday.
But, Frank, I've got to talk...
I want to talk to you, now. You've been a naughty girl.
[to the partygoers]
Back in a minute. A little business, chums.
[to Gina]
A very naughty girl.

I've heard all about it. Are you scared a little, darling? Yes, I know how you feel. The first kill is always a bit trying. I had no idea you were such a good shot. You must try one of those relaxing pills or that hot stuff they advertise, before you go to sleep.
Don't! Don't, Frank. If you won't help me, I don't know who will.

I'll help you, doll. It's just going to be a little expensive, that's all. I'll take care of everything. My partner is no great loss. You haven't got to worry about anything. You just go on looking beautiful. I wish someone would paint you. I wish I could. I'd rather see you hung in the Royal Academy than just - hung.
Now, now, now, don't worry about what's happened today. Unless you decide not to do as I tell you, then, you start worrying. You see, doll, we both need each other.

[to Gina]
Don't forget to smile at the boys.
What did you say - is it this time, our little cargo item?
I didn't say.
Heroin or morphine?
Any difference to you?
I understand heroin is bringing better prices in the States.
That's why it's heroin. You've been studying the fluctuating market, haven't you, Baris?
How are you getting it into Athens?
Who'd expect Lebanese opium, processed in Naples, to go to New York by way of Athens. Brilliant, don't you think?
How much is there this time?
[McNally doesn't answer]
Well, I must know. To judge the space. To make the best arrangements.
About seventy kilos.
Seventy kilos! I haven't planned on so much. Do you realize this is worth - three million dollars.
You have been studying the market, haven't you, Baris.

I too understand you have made some very good buys in Tangier - in industrial diamonds. It should easily cover you're expenses. I see no reason why I shouldn't have a fair profit, too. No, no, no, no. Under these circumstances, I cannot offer you my facilities for less than - fifty thousand dollars or the equivalent.
don't try to blackmail me again or we might. See you around.
Fasten your seat belts, please. Will you put your cigarette out, please?
How's my wandering girl?
Here you are, get your guidebooks to the Catacombs here. Don't get lost in the Catacombs. Spooky. Spooky. Know where you are all the time. Aspirin. Flashlights. Alka-Seltzer? Ice pack?
How about a flashlight? Very dark in the Catacombs. Spooky. Spooky. Make sure you don't fall over - get a run in your stockings. Doesn't anybody want to buy a flashlight?
She ain't comin' out, Max. Not today. You watchin' a dry hole. Her and her friends left. They ain't gonna show.
The minute I'm tired of chasing you, or anything happens to me, they'll pick you up faster than a twenty dollar gold piece.
I sound fascinating.
I stopped being fascinated by dope peddlers a long time ago.
It may interest you to know, that at this moment, you are the target of every thug in Rome who carries a gun.
There's only one thug I care about.
Do you know where she is now?
Athens.
Athens? What would she be doin' goofin' off to a crazy place like Athens?
Because she's a goof.
Frank, I meant I'm not coming with you. You are not going to tell me what to do any more.

[Slaps Gina across the face]
You stupid girl. Here are your tickets. Do you realize I could have had any doll doing errands for me? But I never wanted - any doll. We'll meet on the other side.
